info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 03 at 3:50PM EDT by NWS Wilmington
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT PORTIONS OF OHIO, SOUTHEASTERN RIPLEY, SOUTHWESTERN DEARBORN AND NORTHWESTERN SWITZERLAND COUNTIES THROUGH 415 PM EDT... At 350 PM EDT, a strong thunderstorm was located 7 miles northwest of Vevay, moving north at 10 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph, half inch hail, and very heavy rain. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Hail may cause minor damage to outdoor objects. Visibility will be poor and hydroplaning is possible. Locations impacted include... Pleasant, Fairview, Farmers Retreat, Bear Branch, Friendship, Center Square, Allensville, Aberdeen, Mount Sterling, Jacksonville, Avonburg and Moorefield. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a sturdy building. Motorists should slow down and use extra caution. To report hazardous weather conditions, go to our website at weather.gov/iln and submit your report via social media, when you can do so safely.
